text: Nom. Came with the wife and sister-in-law. The three of us split the Bacino's Special deep-dish (a small one) and the Bacino's Special salad. Plenty enough food for all three of us. They also had good beer on tap. If you're in Lincoln Park, I highly recommend this place!
excellent spinach pizza. I'm glad they are in the neighborhood !

I decided to try this place based on numerous recommendations. I ordered their famous spinach stuffed pizza (bambino-individual). The flavor of the spinach & ricotta mixture with sauce is pretty good. The only thing that held this pizza back from being a favorite was the crust. It was soggy on the bottom and therefore chewier than I'd like. However, placing the pizza on a hot skillet for several minutes made it crispier and that fixed the issue. Definitely noteworthy pizza but doesn't make the cut for my favorites in the city.

They're Pizza Margherita Napoletana was great. I originally ordered the arugula salad and I couldn't eat it. I was amazed how nicely they handled the problem. Very nice over the phone and got another quick delivery of a Pizza instead.   Happy after all.

IDK how they did it but Bacino's makes a deep dish that filled me up after one slice. How?! My hungrier friend and I visited on a weeknight after intense workouts. We placed a carryout order for a build your own pizza and played in nearby Oz Park whilst we waited. Twenty minutes later, tired from all the tire-swing action, we went back to find our deep dish pizza was ready ahead of schedule. We opted to eat inside and there was plenty of seating to do so. Our server was still very attentive, fast and friendly. The scenery appears to be different in every section in a we're-still-working-on-it kinda way, but our booth was comfy. The pizza was delicious and quite filling. I'd happily return after a 2-day fast next time.

Note: This review is just for delivery. I was craving some good pizza and happened upon this place. Everything arrived packaged perfectly and without any errors. We ordered a stuffed spinach, a thin crust veggie, a Caesar salad, and a sausage penne pasta. (I was so hungry!) The stuffed spinach was perfection. Hands down one of *the* absolute best pizzas I've ever had. So cheesy (and with good cheese). A flavorful sauce. And a perfectly done crust. If you haven't had this pizza, you are missing out! I'm not a huge fan of thin crust, but this one was pretty great. And the cheese! Again, such great cheese. The toppings were plentiful. And the crust was tasty. The Caesar salad was plentiful and came with lots of dressing. The pasta was cooked well. But it was lackluster. There was little to no flavor. In sum, get the pizza! The stuffed spinach is delicious!
This is my #1 favorite pizza in Chicago & outlying areas, I have been going there for years and you can buy them half baked and finish baking them at home.   THEY GIVE YOU THE BEST!

NOM. I was visiting from out of town and demanded deep dish (as per usual when I travel to Chicago) and had never even heard of Bacino's before my boyfriend's sister recommended it (I'm always taken to Gino's East, Giordano's or Lou's when visiting). I'm a total sucker for the "local", non-franchise cuisine so I was pretty excited to try it out. We ordered delivery after a day of rooftop drinking and it definitely is the stuff pizza dreams are made of. After trying all of the Chicago deep dish options, I believe I can confidently call myself a deep dish connoisseur and admit it's hard to find the perfect balance of cheese and sauce while also having flavor. Bacino's nailed all fronts. It wasn't super crusty like Lou's, overly cheesy like Giordano's (coming from a Wisconsinite, that's saying something) or too saucy like Gino's East. I'm looking forward to having it again, and also pretending like I'm a Chicago local when recommending it to all my friends.
Stuffed spinach pizza is AMAZING.. coming from a Chicagoan.  Wings are good too.  Fast delivery!

Went here because we wanted to go to Chicago Pizza and Oven Grinder company but the wait was an hour and a half to be seated. We walked over here instead and ordered, ate and left in shorter amount of time than that. As for Bacino's we loved it! The thin crust margherita pizza and deep dish Bacino's special pizza were amazing with great fresh flavors. Not too pricy either a friend and I shared 2 personal pizzas and it was around $20 between both of us. I would definitely recommend this place if you are in the Lincoln park area and in the mood for some pizza!

My trip to Bacino's was based solely on a stranger's suggestion, and I'm thrilled we took the advice.  We walked through the front entrance and my eyes lit up as I stood in front of an *open kitchen* with joy in my heart. I watched the kitchen knead the dough, construct the pies and work the oven as we waited. There was also a small table with free promotional glassware for the customers, so we grabbed a few.  Our server Pricilla was very attentive and always friendly which was very impressive since she was taking care of the entire front dining room where we were seated. The appetizers came out in a timely manner and we waited about 30 minutes for our pizzas, which was not long at all. We started with the bruschetta: the garlic rubbed bread was crunchy, sprinkled with Parmesan cheese, and presented adjacent to the fresh basil, cherry tomatoes and extra virgin olive oil. The toppings were chopped instead of diced, lending to large crisp bursts of flavor with every bite as the balsamic glaze coated the toast without turning it soggy. The Goat cheese salad surprised me the most as the baked cheese and walnut mixture was placed on top of toasted bread like a spread, with the mixed greens and tomatoes on the side. It was warm and delicious, and I will definitely start warming my goat cheese at home when I'm looking for a snack. My friend and I have two completely different tastes when it comes to pizza, so we each ordered our own "small" CYO chicago style stuffed pizza: She chose fresh garlic, jalapeños, and Italian sausage as her rich and hearty ingredients. The spicy combination from the jalapeños and sausage were a perfect balance of heat with the cheese and sauce, but when I tried a bite, i didn't think garlic as a main ingredient made much of an impact because the sauce was already amazingly garlicky and thick...still, the pizza was Delicious! I chose pineapple, black olives, mushrooms, and Canadian bacon for my ingredients because I love me some sweet and savory! I too was in heaven with the taste and presentation of my pizza; I love the black olives on top, not sure if it they were added as an afterthought, but they added color to an already good-lookin' pie! The taste profile was out of this world ("thank you, me" "you're welcome, me") and even after filling up on one slice I HAD to have a second. And a third on the way home. Ordering a small is perfect for me, with extras for the next day- I enjoy a  cold slice just as well as a hot one, and will be back to try the thin crust, which happens to be my favorite style of pizza. -------------- 5/29/17 Ordered a thin crust with pineapple, Canadian bacon, mushrooms, and it was FANTASTIC! The thin crust was a little heavier than I would like, but there were so many ingredients I'm sure a thinner crust couldn't have held the weight of the toppings. Plus- the pizza is cut into squares which I adore because I can eat more by stacking them and making mini pizza sandwiches  *yum yum yum*

Excellent pizza! We're visiting Chicago and i was not disappointed! I added artichokes to the stuffed spinach mushroom pizza; it was perfect! Our food was hot and not soggy when we got it delivered. Highly recommended if you want a hearty meal.

After loving their stuffed pizza in house, we decided to give their thin crust a whirl via delivery. On time, warm and wonderful. The cheese is simply amazing here (without being too greasy) and the flaky crust and just right amount of sauce pull it all together. Oh yeah, the wings were great too! Don't sleep on Bacino's (I know we did!)
BEST PIZZA EVER!  Bacino's deep dish pizza is so good! Crust is light and flakey, the cheese is fantastic! Try the spinach- one of their specialties! Also spinach garlic bread is great!
Ventured to Lincoln Park from River North to grab dinner with friends. The ambience and service were underwhelming, and I definitely had better pizza in Chicago.
This place is an absolute gem. Pizza is second to non and the service is top notch. The owner, Mr. Miguel is an A+++ every time we visit. Give it a try. They also host big parties.

there is no question that the spinach pie is what dreams are made of.  The thin crust cheese is always spot on.  Delivery (even over here to Bucktown) is quick and foolproof.  We've been doing this for 12 years and made a lot of out of towner into believers

This review is unfortunately not for the pizza, as it never made it to us. We placed an order for delivery and everything went through fine, and then a little bit later I checked my email to see what the estimated delivery time would be. I find an email saying the order had been cancelled with no explanation. I called, and was told "Oh, you placed an order for delivery? Sorry, we have no driver today. He didn't show up for work." Ummm, what?! And you didn't think to call to let me know as soon as I placed my order?! That's bad customer service. Won't be going back here.

An great alternative to anyone who wants to pass on the overly packed busyness of Giordanos. We ordered the spinach deep dish an a bruschetta app. The bruschetta on its own was super fresh and tasty (the tomatoes were amazing), and the pizza was good even for the 25 minute wait. Plus, our waitress was very kind and offered to let us sample a couple of wines before we committed to a whole bottle. Atmosphere was a lovely cross between casual diner and fine eatery.

My boyfriend and I really liked Bacinos and he's an out of Towner. We were exploring Lincoln park during the night the cubs won the NLCS and were craving pizza but KNEW everywhere would be filled. We stumbled upon this place and were so excited that there was no wait! This place has a lot of history and the wait staff was very accommodating. As much as I love cheese however, I thought this deep dish had an overwhelming amount and the crust was very dry. I would definitely come back! It's just not my favorite deep dish joint in Chicago.

I would NOT suggest ordering delivery from Bacino's Lincoln Park. They estimated my order would take an hour to be delivered and it ended up taking close to 3 hours. I asked if they could get in touch with the driver and the woman at Bacino's said "she wasn't sure who the driver was to contact him". When I got my food, it was decent at best and pizza felt like it had been sitting out for awhile. Plus I had a $3 off coupon that they forgot to apply.
Got the Stuffed Pizza.  It was great.  Crust was nice and flakey and the sauce was full of flavor.  Went to the Famous Lou Malnati's last year when I visited.  This place so much better.

What a happy surprise! While not a Chicago native, I used to visit very frequently and had my favorite deep dish spots. (Lou Malnati's FTW!) However, another friend wanted to stop by a popular pizza place near Lincoln Park and 10 minutes after opening, it was already a 2+ hour wait. So, off to yelp to find another option to satisfy our grumbling bellies. Although it made us a little wary, the restaurant was mostly empty early afternoon on a Saturday. But our worries were unfounded, because we had amazing service, delicious pizza and drinks. The mozzarella bread was good, but kind of small. But the pizzas were flavorful and the marinara sauce was tasty! Glad we got to check this pizza place out and looking forward to returning on my next trip!
Good, simple pizza place with what seemed to this out of towner to be real deal Chicago style stuffed pizza.

Stuffed deep dish was awesome! We walked right into our table and the service was on point. We ordered mozzarella bread but it was quite disappointing small, really good but small. The cheeses were amazing but I got a piece of ice cheese pizza, weird but I pressed on. The pizza was delicious, the sauce was meaty and fresh. I'd definitely come here again! My favorite deep dish.

The deep dish pizza was pretty good, super cheesy! Also tried the fried calamari, which was also pretty good. But the sauce for calamari was hot, which I didn't quite understand or like. The only thing might be annoying was it took more than 30 min to get the deep-dish pizza ready. I understand there are more steps to make a stuffed pizza, but still, there must be some way to expedite it.
Customer service was EXCELLENT. Pizza was better than Lou Malnati's. Really cheesy and great atmosphere. Definitely would visit this place again.

Ok so my fave so far is their Penne Bolognese. I request spaghetti noodles instead. It's served with truffle oil which I think is why I like it so much. I would order it again & again. We also got to try their thin crust pizza. Just a cheese w/black olives (nothin fancy). I enjoyed it. The cheese was nice & gooey & the crust was real good. It's not far from where we live too which is nice. Can't wait to come again!
Just sliiiiightly undercooked deep dish crust, but not egregious, so we ate our small anyway, and it was delicious. Not too crowded (we escaped from that other place), either.

First experience with deep dish and this place knocked it out of the park! We had a large group and ordered the special and the spinach.  My friends that have lived in Chicago said this place was tops! Highly recommended calling ahead to place your order, we called about 3 hours ahead and they had our pizza made right on time.

I'm not sure how Bacino's flew under my pizza radar for so long, but wow, what a gem! I stumbled upon this place browsing yelp. Obviously taking 2 seconds looking at photos, they're known for their stuffed pizza. However, I didn't see many thin crust reviews. So what did I do? I got both. Cheese lovers, add this place to the top of your list. They are extremely generous with the cheese on both styles. The stuffed was amazing; avoiding the sogginess of other places with a maintained crispy crust on top and bottom. This is a flour based crust, which I prefer over rivals with cornmeal. What I liked about the pepperoni and sausage stuffed was how it tasted light. I didn't feel disgusting after eating it like other pizzas. (I'm not going to go into detail about their "heart healthy" famous spinach pizza, but google it or ask them about it!) The sausage was good, not the greatest, but well-seasoned and juicy. The sauce was savory and natural tasting. Now the thin crust, it tasted very similar to the stuffed, but obviously executed differently. It was super filling for a thin crust! You really can't go wrong here at Bacino's. It is also rumored that Bacino's is a sister location to Giordano's dating back to the 70's. I give Bacino's the edge though on this one. It is a "need it" on your pizza list!
Pizza: Really great.  Delivery: Maybe understaffed.  I've ordered multiple times and the delivery execution needs work.

We were at Lincoln zoo looking for Chicago style deep dish Pizza.  Yelp search for 'deep dish pizza' returned Brick and Rinaldi that were near zoo but they don't have deep dish.  This place was a little farther 10 min. walk up the street from those other 2 on Lincoln but Pizza was terrific.  Hot out of the oven, crust crisp and easy to chew, delicious, fast and friendly service, and  clean .  We (2) ordered Bacino special bambino and house salad.  As they politely say, we were very satisfied  (i.e., full).  We will return next time we are back in Chicago.
They have a homemade spinach/cheese blend that is a standard order in our house.  Doesn't leave you with that icky greasy pizza feeling.

I took a very large party here last week, and first of all, let me say that the service was top notch.  Our server was extremely helpful and the restaurant was very accommodating, giving us a large room of our own. This is why I am giving a 3 star, rather than a 2 star rating, because the pizza simply did not stack up to other deep dish pies I've eaten in Chicago in the past.  The sauce flavor was fine, and the sausage was delicious and spicy, but there simply weren't enough toppings and there was WAY too much cheese for any kind of balanced flavor.

So yummy!  I visited this place while I was in Chicago after I went on a walking tour of Lincoln Park.  The tour guide recommended this place, and he was so right - this was some of the best pizza I've ever had!  I loved it so much that I went back two days later before I left Chicago.  Yummy deep dish.  I ordered an italian sausage personal pizza and I think I paid about $7.  Unlike other reviewers, I had a good experience with the customer service.  I guess the place is a bit slow, but everyone was super friendly and polite.   The waitress helped me figure out what kind of pizza to get and what toppings I might like.  10/10 would recommend.

My wife and I decided to order delivery from here based on the great reviews we were reading on Yelp.  We are new to the city and are trying out pizza places to see which we like best.  To our disappointment, the pizza arrived cold and very bland tasting.  The wings we got were pretty good, though, so the dinner was not a total waste, but in terms of pizza, this place should be avoided.

***WARNING ONE OF THE RUDEST CUSTOMER SERVICE EXPERIENCES I HAVE ENCOUNTERED!  I normally order a medium thin crust from Bacino's as I have been doing for the past 8 years because I do love their pizza. I've lived in the Lincoln Park neighborhood for awhile as well. I always recommend this place to family and friends because the pizza is flavorful, not too greasy and the service is usually great!  Unfortunately, this was not what I experienced today when I went to dine in with a family member of mine who was visiting. We arrived during their lunch hour on a Tuesday. The restaurant had one other table. Needless to say this was not rush hour by any means.  Miguel took our order. We ordered a large Bacino's special. When we came back to get our pizza we were given a medium. Fine a simple mistake. No big deal. I spoke with the server who was extremely accommodating and friendly. She said she would relay the message to Miguel, the man at the front who took our order. She came back to relay the message and we were told we would have to pay for another small pizza if we wanted to put in another order we could- again, no big deal, right?  However, when I went to speak with Miguel to resolve the situation -I overheard him saying to the server, "This lady's a pain in my ass!" Then when he walked out of to the front of the restaurant to approach me the first thing he said to me in an aggressive manner and tone was, "I did only charge you for a medium, right?" When I tried to explain to him that we explicitly put in an order for a large and this was why I was dissatisfied, again he chose to speak to me aggressively instead of simply apologizing and admitting his mistake. The server even apologized profusely for Miguel's actions. (By the way she was great!) A simple, "I am sorry-What can I do to fix this?" would have done the trick. Instead, Miguel said rather rudely, "We're giving you a small on the house."  Miguel did not once apologize or admit his mistake, in addition to his comment about me being,  "A pain in his ass."  Unfortunately, or maybe fortunately, I did not ask to speak with their manager. I will no longer be ordering from Bacino's or dining in again until they have less hostile customer service at their front desk.

As good as I remembered the one downtown from 20 years ago. In town for Cubs games and went in for a late lunch. Called ahead for stuffed pizzas and didn't wait long. Small plus bambino was perfect for 3 of us to try a couple different styles. Definitely recommend.
Very good pizza and pasta. Great customer service. Nice location. Good ambiance. Fresh ingredients and nice size portions.

If you have babies, restrooms don't have diaper changing tables in the restrooms.  Manager was rude servicing a big family with kids.  During, my visit another customer called the police for bad treatment from the manager!  Not the place you want to be with kids and family.

After going to Lincoln Park's Zoo, my friends and I were in the mood for some pizza. It was a 15 minute walk from the park. We we seated immediately at a booth. We ordered the mozzarella stuffed garlic bread, spinach supreme chicago-style stuffed pizza, the bacino special, and the bird on the grill panini. Keep in mind, there is at least a 30 minute wait for the pizzas! Everything tasted great. The panini was delicious and good enough for lunch and dinner.  Service was efficient and friendly!

What's more fun than deep dish? Stuffed deep dish. Sunday late afternoon and this place is surprisingly quiet. Got a nice seat against the window as I looked through all the options. Once again, no slices, just pies. However, at a relatively paltry 6", this is a pizza that's doable solo. settled on the Spinach Supreme Stuffed ($8.50) and a glass of red ($7.50). Firstly, the wine is surprisingly good here - was more of an afterthought when I ordered it. After 30minutes I finally got my pie - steaming hot and looking as good as the pictures. Cheesy interior with the right amount of spinach (and mushrooms). The crust is crisped well as I was able to finish the whole thing off without having to unbuckle my pants. Service here is super friendly as they went through the menu for me without complaint. Price is just right as well. Would 100% recommend over your standard deep dish.

Good deep dish pizza, which is why we came in. We were referred by a tour guide who did a gangster tour of the Lincoln Park area. The restaurant is located three blocks from the Fullerton Red Line stop. The pizza is worth coming in for and the Irish boiler maker was also a hit.

I am a big fan of Bacino's.  I order from here once every two months or so.  I typically get the Spinach Supreme with mushrooms.  The staff is pretty friendly/professional on the phone and I have never had any issues with delivery.  I just assume that the pizza is going to take around an hour, plus or minus 15 minutes, for delivery. If you are getting delivery, make sure to crisp the crust back up in the oven before eating it.  350 degrees for 12-15 minutes gets the pizza ready for peak enjoyment! Sucks to not be able to eat the pizza right away, but the quality goes way up with the 15 minute investment.
This place truly has the BEST stuffed deep dish pizza I've ever had. Everything was delicious and the service was great!

*This is based on delivery only* Awesome stuffed, spinach pizza!! Huge, cheesy. Can "add mushrooms for no charge" on the special spinach pie. The only reason for not 5 stars? I know if I order a large stuffed for delivery from here...I will be pushing $50. But, it is super yummy, filling, and freezes well for leftovers!
YAAAAAAAAS. I don't even like deep dish girl but bacinos has my heart and my stomach. Just take all my organs and my money

This was the best pizza I had in Chicago. I had the stuffed spinach pizza and I'm still dreaming about it. The sauce was AMAZING. And the crust was super good too. Don't waste you're time at other pizza places and go here.
Bacinos has my favorite deep dish pizza in the entire city of Chicago! Any time I find myself in the neighborhood I make it a point to eat there. The service is always good and the food is amazing!

Came with a group of 12 and the waiter all but ignored us. Our waters ran dry, we didn't see a waiter for 40 minutes at a time, and they refused to split up our check. There was no one else in the restaurant, either. Good pizza, shitty service.

This is our neighborhood go-to for carry out. Always have it done in 20 min (thin crust), always correct and always friendly.  We ordered 6 x-large pizzas + large salad for birthday party and needed them to deliver it right on time. They were not a minute late, all were perfectly cooked and all 40 people were amazed at how awesome everything was. It was all consumed by 7 that night and we way over ordered.  This place is by far our favorite, always reliable, never long for carry out and they realize you have other options so their service is kind and grateful.

I stopped at Bacino's of Lincoln Park during a food tour. We got to sample a slice of the Spinach Supreme (Bacino's special blend of spinach, cheeses, herbs & spices).  It is a stuffed pizza instead of deep dish.  I thought it was OK but not amazing. I felt the spinach lacked flavor and made the pizza a bit moister than it should have been.  I like a lot of flavor and a crisp crust and it just wasn't there for me. I would give it another shot but I wouldn't order the spinach.

I looooooove this place.  We came in at 6:30 on a Thursday night and I was surprised to see how empty the place was! Our server was cheery and helpful. Yelpers everywhere glorified the spinach stuffed pizza so that's what we ordered. And because we were feeling so fat from our lunch at The Purple Pig earlier that day (which doesn't explain why we're eating pizza for dinner), we ordered the vegetarian stuffed pizza. We also ordered a salad, but nobody cares for that... right? To be honest, I had my doubts about this place. I saw all these reviews for the spinach pizza and I kept wondering, "What could be so good about a spinach pizza??" But after I had my first bite, my answer punched me in the tongue. Perfectly balanced flavors and textures, the spinach actually tasted fresh, and to my pleasant surprise, it wasn't even that heavy despite all the glorious cheese oozing out from every angle. I think I was making indecent noises the entire time I was eating that calamity from heaven. As for the vegetarian pizza.. I almost forgot we even ordered it. It wasn't bad, but it definitely couldn't stand up to the spinach pizza. Ah, I'm drooling as I type..  I was pretty much gloating for the rest of the night. The food was just THAT good. After having spent $68 for lunch at The Purple Pig and feeling less than cheerful about it, Bacino's of Lincoln Park was a very welcome relief to not only my wallet, but to my pigged-out tastebuds. Spent way less and walked out way happier - what more could I ask for? Next time I come to Chicago, I'm going straight here for my first meal.  I love you, Bacino's of Lincoln Park! (Make sure you check out Oz Park across the street. Pretty cool)

Bacino's Lincoln Park has by far the best deep dish pizza in the city!! It has the perfect proportions of cheese, toppings and crust... not to mention the crust is phenomenal. My husband and I have been there numerous times over the past six years, and they never fail to put a smile on our face. The quality is consistent and the service is always great. We keep finding ourselves going back to Bacino's and rating it an easy #1 even after trying several other pizza locations, including Pequod's, Giardiano's, Lou Malnati's and Uno Pizzeria. Anytime we have visitors in town, this is our go-to deep dish pizza restaurant. Try Bacino's and you'll never want to go anywhere else!

Literally one of the best Italian restaurants in Chicago! A friend and I came here while we were in the neighborhood and we weren't disappointed. I can honestly say this place is much better than Giordano's.  I ordered the Cavatappi con Pollo, along with toasted raviolis. My friend ordered a personal pizza (she's super picky but she absolutely loved it).

Had the deep dish pizza and is was great. Not as greasy as at some other places. The service was good also, and the restaurant is nice. It never seems to be a lot of people at this place, which surprises me considering how good the food is. I will be back.

I have been a die hard Giordano's fan for many years.  My weekend trips to Chicago always include a stop to either Giordano's and/or Portillo's.   I believe I may be struck by lightning for the blasphemy I am about to speak:  Bacino's is the best deep dish pizza in Chicago, PERIOD.   I have tried Giordano's, Lou Malnati's, Pizano's, Gino's East, and Pequod's, and none of them are as good as Bacino's.  Their crust is easily better than even Lou' s butter crust, and the sauce has a much fresher tomato taste than the others.  Over all, if you want to experience the best, definitely check out Bacino's in Lincoln Park, you'll agree with me I guarantee it!!!

A really great place for deep dish pizza!! I got the spinach/mushroom and it was great. The cheese is really fresh - they get it from Wisconsin. The toasted ravioli was also pretty good! The veggies were fresh and even the salad that came with the toasted ravioli was tasty. Service was fast and friendly. The place is quaint and it reminds you of that old but good pizza corner.

Okay, this place has over 275 reviews, so there's not much I can say that isn't a repeat. So this is what I will give Bacino's: my BF and I are planning a trip to Chicago right now and Bacino's is the only place we've been before that he wants to repeat. Out of 10+ places carefully chosen as the best Chicago has to offer, Bacino's is what he considers not only the best food in the city, but also the best pizza of his life. So if you trust the recommendation of a man who has eaten a lot of pizza in a lot of cities, then give Bacino's a try. Your mouth will not regret the insane amount of cheese you will be putting in it.

This was another Groupon find, and being a sucker for pizza, I had to check this out. We got the sausage and spinach stuffed pizza, and it was a really good choice. The balance of cheese, sauce and stuffings was nicely done and I enjoyed my meal thoroughly. It is a small little store and when we went, there was maybe 2 other tables full with people.  Only thing that could be better was that the server did not know how to deal with Groupons. He wasn't too happy that we didn't mention we had it before he seated us (we never do that usually and never came across a problem), and made a big deal that there is a difference between the deal and what we got so we'll have to pay out of pocket. We had no problem with that and took care of it. Might be back if I'm in the area.

Great supreme deep dish pizza. Second time having it and realizing for deep dish it's really good and not heavy. Had spinach  and complementary mushrooms! Super filling while not causing you to let out your pants. Great place for cheesy garlic bread. Friendly and family oriented place. Really enjoyed the pizza and the atmosphere

Finding a place to get pizza on a Saturday night for a group of six is quite difficult.  The best part of our experience at Bacino's was calling to see what the wait would be and being told 15 minutes.  Every other place in the area was quoting at least an hour.  We arrived at the restaurant and were seated within five minutes.  And then we sat and sat and sat some more, waiting for someone to approach our table to greet us and ask if we'd like something to drink besides water.  The people who are responsible for water for the table were good.  We waited so long that someone from the group went up to the front to ask if someone would come take our order.  It was still several minutes before our server finally reached us.  During all of this time, I didn't see a single server in the section where we were seated.  Where were they?  Did they just disappear?  Are they so poorly staffed that they cannot handle a Saturday evening dinner crowd?  We finally got our drink and pizza orders in.  I was served the wrong wine, but of course I never had a chance to say something because our server didn't return until after our pizza was almost gone.  The pizza was just okay, nothing memorable.  I've had much better pizza at other places in Chicago.  It was a huge disappointment especially since we had out of town guests with us. I will not be returning.

Pizza is great but why stay open late and over charge per slice...6 Dollars a slice is way too much...so many bars...you could attract so much business but you are a tad overpriced....3 slices of pepperoni for 19 dollars...far overpriced but the quality was good, wouldnt try it a 2nd time at these prices

Stuffed pie is where it's at.  We skipped the spinich and went with our preferred version of pepperoni and garlic.   This pizza was delicious. Cheesy, perfectly seasoned, and with a perfectly crispy crust.  Well worth a visit.

Came here on a Monday night and it was very quiet. Seems like they get more take-out during the week. I ended up ordering the pizza to go. They come in several sizes, including a personal-sized pizza. It seems tiny (~6inches in diameter??), but it is filling! I ordered the special and the broccoli pizza. In hindsight, I probably should have gone with the spinach one instead of the broccoli. The broccoli was still crispy and could have been chopped up into smaller pieces because it was a bit unwieldy to eat. However, aside from that, the pizza was tasty! The crust was fantastic -- thick, crispy, chewy... Lots of cheese. Yum!

Calamari was decent. The Spinach pizza is decent/good. Delivery took a while, the pizza was soggy when it got to us, thats the issue with delivery not with the pizza. I like my deepdish crust crispier than what they serve here.
This is the best pizza place. I recommend the stuffed pizza. It's so good. Second time I have been here. Def worth the trip

I came in with high hopes for this place because it came with high regards from Serious Eats. But, for the second time, Serious Eats really failed in their recommendation. We got the Sausage Supreme Stuffed Pizza for which they were supposedly acclaimed. This pizza came with pie-like crust, cheese, sausage (Italian), Peppers, Onions, and Tomato sauce. The only good part was the sausage. The peppers and onions were still crunchy, throwing off the consistency of the entire pie. The crust was just like a pie's. It lacked any greasiness or chewiness that makes pizza so good. Finally, the sauce was far too sweet and lacked savoriness. It upsets me that we made a special side trip off the Red line to come visit this place. Skip it and find something better.

After walking around town for hours we figured we'd try the pizza in Chicago. We originally planned on going to the Pizza and oven grinder, but the wait was a little over an hour. I'm actually glad it was since it lead us here.  Staff is absolutely amazing and the pizza is the best pizza we've had in a while. Definitely coming back when in town!

Ordered online.. Only offers 1 package of crushed peppers if you want extra, it costs more!! They charge you for utensils and 3.50 for a side of giardiniera?? Place is stupid... must not be making any money to charge for utensils!! Expect us to eat with our bare hands?? Lost my business
Came here on Lincoln Food Tour. I had the Spinach Stuffed Pizza. Very different, the crust was a little tough, but the sauce was great!

Some drunk guy in a bar convinced us to go here instead of Lou Malnatis. I think I will carry that regret with me for years. The pizza wasn't bad, but it wasn't Lou's. We did have good service and a friendly waiter, but the restaurant was empty so attentive service was expected. If you do eat here,  call ahead and order your pizza so you don't have to wait for it when you get there.

I recommend for the food, but don't if you plan to order online or through the phone. They take about 45 minutes more than the quoted time and you end up standing around for a few extra minutes alone in the corner.  Lesson - if you order online or on the phone - add an additional 45 minutes to your wait time. This has happened to me too many times.

Out of town looking for some good Chicago pizza- Bacino's came highly recommended from a friend and did not disappoint: First, the garlic bread was AMAZING!! For only $3, you have to try it! Sit, relax with a beer and enjoy a great lunch. It was a beautiful summer day so they had the windows open. My husband ordered the stuffed pizza while I had the "thin"- which is more like our "regular" back home in Texas! Service was great- food was great- atmosphere was great. NO complaints!

As a pizza connoisseur, i wanted to try this place out for the first time. A group of friends and I came to try this place out because i heard so many good things about it. So here's my take on Bacino's... First, the restaurant itself is old and nothing special to look at. In fact, tables are cramped in and you'll be bumping into the people behind you every time you need to get up. A 4/top is extremely cramped with two medium pizzas on it. Second, the pizza itself must have sat out before they brought it out to the table. The cheese wasn't cheesy, and the pizza itself wasn't piping hot. and it also took twice as long to come out to the table. The server said allow 30-35 minutes for the pizza to come out. It took an hour for both pies to come to the table. Maybe something to do with the service itself. As far as taste, not Chicago's best, if you're looking for Chicago's best there are many better pizza joints. As far as pricing, on the more expensive end of pizza and expect to pay full price even for half toppings (ridiculous) we did a half specialty spinach pizza and the other half with two toppings and said "since im paying full price for the toppings, i want the full portion of both on that side" and portions were very very light. The second pizza was no different, both came out together, both nothing special, both were not hot at all. To give you an idea, an appetizer, a medium and a small deep dish, and three drinks with tip over $100-ridiculous. Now service, one would think with what you payed for the food, that you'd get dazzled with the service and the service was the worst of all of the aspects of the evening. The server was inattentive and he disappeared for 30+ minutes at one point, even things such as refills when he would come to the table we would have to ask for. Even seeing, or expecting him to see the empty glasses, he still didn't ask if we needed refills. In any event, if you got money to burn, time to waste, and don't really care about the taste of your food, then by all means go there. But if you're looking for some truly great pizza, you can't go wrong with Malnati's or Pequod's and probably save a few bucks as well.
Amazing biscuit pizza! I went there last night. Garlic bread and dipping sauce on par. I recommend this beautiful place.
Might be the best stuffed pizza in Chicago, a true hidden gem. The cheese they use is amazing.
Excellent pie and friendly service.  I came here with my two kids on a Saturday night and had a great time.  Will definitely be back again soon.  Highly recommended.

My husband and I love this place. We never understand why there aren't very busy when we go there but they are always so nice and friendly when we come in.  The olive and bread appetizer is amazing and a perfect light start for a meal.  We've had both the deep dish and the thin crust and both are equally amazing. We've also tried the cheese bread which could use a little more seasoning to give it some more flavor but besides that, Bacino's is a great family restaurant or casual date night spot.  If you're going to try anything, get the deep dish!

We went using a groupon pizza deal for 2 for $27. Had an amazing dinner! The small thick pizza was perfectly cheesy and enough for 3 people. I will definitely be back here when I'm in the area. I forgot to mention that our server was absolutely delightful. Very attentive and made a good local beer recommendation.

Even though I've never been too Bacino's, I've had their taste portion deep dish spinach at the Taste of Chicago, AND OH MY GOD IS IT DELICIOUS!  I'm not kidding, when I used to go to the Taste of Chicago(I don't anymore) Bacino's was always the first stand I would look for. I used to take the South Shore to Van Buren and if I remember correctly, Bacino's was always set up on the northwest corner of Columbus and Jackson. For the longest time I've been wanting to make it to their restaurant. I haven't yet, but I will eventually. I can't wait to check out what other delicious items they have on their menu! Edwardo's Pizza has an excellent deep dish spinach pizza too, but still not as good as Bacino's.

First time here we purchased a groupon I was greeted instantly and seated the waiter was extremely nice we ordered a deep dish with Spinach it was delishhhh hands down best pizza I've had In a while I would Recommend them for Deep dish pizza I will def come Back great Service and food

Ah, Bacino's. In my quest to try as many deep dish/stuffed pizzas around Chicago as I possibly can, I discovered Bacino's of Lincoln Park (on one of those lists that boast the best deep dish pizzas of Chicago). We had been planning on dining here for months before the stars finally aligned and we made the 40-minute trek from the 'burbs. We were able to score a pretty good pay-to-park spot, which was exciting considering Lincoln Park can be tough because there are so many parking spots that require a permit. We walked in and were surprised to discover that there was not a soul dining at Bacino's on a weeknight. There were a bunch of workers sitting around listlessly using their phones and joking around. We (of course) got our pick of seats, so we opted for a booth. The booth was pretty big with tall backs such that I felt enveloped in a very pleasing all-encompassing way. Comfy! I'm not sure why I thought this was a good idea at the time, but when David C. asked me what size we should order, I said "large." We got the spinach stuffed large pizza. We waited about 35 minutes for it to be ready (exactly within the quoted amount of time). It was a very large and in charge pizza, stuffed to the brim with ample cheese and spinach. The menu said something about it being the only "heart healthy" stuffed pizza and I'm wondering if this is meant to be a joke? Clearly there was nothing (but maybe spinach) "heart healthy" about this bad boy. And we weren't complaining.  Naturally, we were way too stuffed to even take a look at the dessert menu, but our friendly waitress still gave us tiny homemade chocolate chip cookies. This was such a treat and a great touch! Bacino's is definitely one of the best stuffed pizzas in Chicago and is very deserving of a spot in the top five. Is it *the* best? I've yet to determine that, as I have more exploring of the Chicago pizza landscape to do.

Great deep dish (and thin crust) without the crazy weekend lines at the downtown tourist hot spots. I love that you can get a personal pan (bambino size) deep dish here - no more arguing over toppings!  My family always makes it a point to go here when they visit from out of state.
Delicious pizza or should I say casserole. Either way the amount of cheese was crazy. Server was friendly and very attentive. Next time im in Chicago this will be my first stop for stuffed pizza.

The pizza is amazing! The best I had while in Chicago. I was worried it would be too saucy but the way they add the sauce layer on top makes it blend perfectly. This was our first time eating a stuffed pizza and we loved it! It had just the right amount of cheese, spinach, and not too much crust. We also enjoyed the intimate and charming decor. Highly recommended!

They used to have an extensive beer list in addition to offering flights. When I came in recently and asked about it, the server looked at me like I was crazy. Don't know what prompted them to make this change, but it has certainly lessened my desire to dine in. I'm strictly delivery now.

I'm gonna' keep it short; best pizza I've ever had in my LIFE! The stuffed pizza was amazing, and amazing is an understatement.  I went to Lou Malnati's and that place couldn't even compare to Bacino's.  The service as Bacino's was excellent and the food was to die for.  It took 40 minutes for our stuffed pizzas to be made but it was well worth the wait.  If you're in Chicago, don't go anywhere else for pizza.
The best pizza I have ever had in my life... I feel like I came all the way from VA for this place (I didn't honestly)

My favorite stuffed pizza in Chicago. Great buttery crust, awesome chunky sauce, ingredients and cheese are delicious just a solid deep dish all around. I come here pretty frequently and have introduced many friends to Bacinos. You won't be disappointed!

The pizza here is delicious. But, at $5/slice for an average size, it's excessively expensive. No free water available, they charge you $3 for a bottle and refuse to give you tap water. I asked for parmesan cheese and they acted like I was bothering them. Shocked this place isn't failing, it's crazy expensive and overrated. Avoid.
Best deep dish I've had to date. Flaky crust that held up to the yummy toppings. Highly recommended. We came in a Thursday evening and no crowd. Great find.

Amazing. Ordered calamari and a Caesar salad thinking we weren't that hungry. Delicious! Then couldn't help ordering a small deep dish spinach and mushroom pizza because people at the next table had one and it looked TOO good! Perfection. Crisp crust, perfectly seasoned...and excellent service. Yum!

Bacinos forgot lesson 1 of customer service. When you delay the promised delivery time and never call to alert the customer, that is a problem.  When the delivery stretched 25 minutes past the promised time, we attempted to call the restaurant. We were put on hold-twice- and after another three minute hold had to redial once again. Ultimately the manager answered the telephone and stated that when taking the original order, his employee left off one of the numbers of the charge card.  Of course these mistakes happen but what you don't do is delay the order and not even call the customer, busy or not. Instead he just had the pizzas and salads just sit there waiting to be delivered. What the manager should do do and what he never did, is apologize profusely and explain that the pizza will be delivered immediately. This manager, who said he's been employed at the restaurant for five months not only did not apologize for his employee's error but didn't even make the gesture of deleting a delivery charge or even send a complementary desert. Either gesture would have been appreciated and it's a pretty standard reaction on the part of a restaurant. I attempted to provide the manager with an opportunity to make up for the error and calmly stated that I've been ordering from his restaurant for over 17 years and rarely run into problems. But tonight this delay embarrassed me in front of several out-of-town guests who are visiting and who earlier in the day had visited the restaurant at my recommendation. $70 is not a small bill at a pizza restaurant and I wondered if the owner (Dan) was aware of the poor attitude and incompetence issues existing with his manager of five months? I would find that hard to believe! So sorry Bacino, your normal five stars dropped to one star. And in your world of greater consumer choices and intense competitive pressure in the deep dish world, this can not happen too often. And yes, I know your year's success is based not on guys like me only buying $70 of pizza or others buying your $5 slice but instead Pitch Fork or Lollapalooza (I forget which one you supply). However don't forget the lesson your old neighbor Enzo taught you, that selling the festival is great but sometimes is not enough to carry you when your employees fail you and let you down.  And buy the way, tonight's poor experience really left a terrible taste in my mouth and not even your tasty pizza and salad helped remove it.

I've had stuffed/deep dish pizza from only a couple places in Chicago. Bacino's is also pretty good. I shared the Bacino's Special stuff pizza with a coworker. Sauce is excellent! I wish they put more on. Lots of cheese just like the others other there.  Server was attentive and they can open their windows in the bar area to give a patio feel.  Nice place.

Bacino's used to be my go to place, right around the corner and usually delivery within 30 min no longer then 45. Recently the deliveries have been much longer and the quality has suffered. My last order was called in at 6:45 PM and I was still waiting at 8:00 PM. We called to find out what was going on and were given a bunch of BS like the driver just left he is on his way. Once the guy arrives 90 min later the box looked like someone stepped on it. I opened it and half the pie was stuck to the top not to mention ice cold. I attempted to send it back with the driver and he said I need to call. He even denied any fault as he blamed the guy at the restaurant. I refused delivery and called immediately I spoke to a manager who gave attitude and had to be convinced that the order was completely wrong. After a long deliberation he reluctantly agreed to send another pie. 30 more min have passed without any dinner. Remove the Bacino's menu from your drawer. They have lost my business.

I had to try their stuffed pizza while visiting Chicago.  The service was friendly.  I got there a bit early since no one was there besides another family.  It was good but ever since I ate at Lou Malnati's, I couldn't really enjoy the pizza.  The tomato sauce didn't have the tangy kick like what I had at Lou Malnati's.  I feel bad for comparing but I can't lie that this place just had okay pizza.

Absolutely the best stuffed pizza in the city.  I took out of town guests here and we ordered the stuffed spinach with mushroom.  The cheese they use is heart healthy cheese, something they are known for and I think it taste better than other cheeses used by other pizza places. I also think the tomato sauce is the best I've ever had. This is amazing pizza and I would skip Gino's and other pizza places located downtown and come here.  My out of town guests loved the pizza.  They  had stuffed pizza for the first time and it was a very memorable experience for them. I highly recommend all you Chicago tourists to come here.  If your staying downtown , you'll need to cab it, it's worth it. You can call ahead and preorder on the phone and you'll have only a short wait for your pizza when you arrive.  One more thing this is the pizza they serve at the Taste of Chicago, but without the mushrooms, just stuffed spinach, so if u can't make it to the taste in the summer, it's here all year round.  Service is also good.  We all had a nice walk thru lincoln park to get there , but if you drive parking may be difficult.  The also have a good selection of beers.
Best pizza in Chicago! Definitely try the stuffed spinach!

I am going to say the only bad thing of this review was trying to find parking. The good: everything else Our waiter was super knowledgable about the food and the beer. He suggested that since we were getting the stuffed pizza, it would be best to get beers and an appetizer. All I said is that we wanted local brews and he pointed us to his personal favorites, and let me tell you he hit it right on the head! His service was great, the pizza was phenomenal (get a size bigger than you think for the day after). The waiter even helped hold the pizza just right so I could get the perfect shot to send to all of my friends. This was by far the best dine-in pizza experience I had in a long time. Well worth the money!

Would have been 2.5 stars but this place knows what customer service is. I ordered the Bacino's Special stuffed, 2 their special pies (take note of this) and gave me a side of peppers instead I don't know why you can't add to their specials but it is what it is. Ordering is easy & customer service is great Delivery guy shows up and rather than delivering to my door, calls me and asks me to come to the lobby of my building to pick up my pizza (I hate when drivers do this). He forgets to deliver the side of Giardiniera but I didn't notice till I got back up to my place. I call back and the guy on the phone pretty much assured me that he would make sure I get the peppers b/c I paid for them, he sends the driver back with the remainder of my order.  The pizza is awesome! Delivery can improve, phone ordering was surprisingly easy and nice.

I ordered two large half baked then frozen pizza's on line to take to my cousin in Colorado a week before Christmas. When I arrived to pick them up, I was told that they raised their prices a few weeks before, but hadn't updated their website, so my $24 pizza's were now $29. I think they should have honored the price on the website. not simply given me the friend and family discount of a few bucks. Also there weren't any directions for finishing the baking process. Not impressed.

I stopped in for a quick bite before heading to the airport. The food and service was great! I had the bird on the grill panini and my buddy had the Cavatapi Con Pollo which was excellent! If I had more time I would've tried the stuff pizza. I will definitely come back to this place and try other items on the menu too! Place was clean, cozy & casual.

The food was fantastic, service was slow. I have driven by this place several times while in Chicago and I have always been interested, but had other plans. I am glad that I finally had a chance to try it out This isn't some kitschy tourist trap, this is an actual neighborhood haunt and that is what I want when I am in this town The food really was great, their crust has great flavor and their sauce is great Pros: food, prices, menu variety, and atmosphere  Cons: service was slow, and try don't serve Coca Cola (this is a Cardinal Sin if you are a pizzeria) I will go back

Smaller establishment with friendly, helpful service and great pizza! We started with some hot wings which were good, pretty standard--and then went with the stuffed spinach pizza and added some Italian sausage. It was fantastic. We came at a not busy time, but the pizza came out quickly and our server, Tom, helped expertly dish it out with his deft hands. The spinach is NOT overwhelming or gross as spinach can sometimes be, there was plenty of delicious cheese, and a perfect amount of sauce. As far as crust goes: one of the best I've had. Crispy, not soggy, not too thick or thin, and with an almost flaky texture. High five, Bacino's.  The beer selection is also extensive so go crazy.  There is a large room downstairs that would be great for parties which is also where the bathrooms are located. There's only stairs to get down there though so I'm gonna go ahead and say they are not handicap accessible as far as I can tell.  Five Stars for Tom as well. You go, Tom.

I can't give enough stars! We were so lucky to have stumbled upon this place. My boyfriend's parents ended up speaking to the owner John McMahon who was originally from their home town of Peoria, IL. It's a small world. John brought us 4 hot chocolates on the house since we came in from the 21° weather.  Our spinach, mushroom and cheese stuffed pizza was the BEST we had ever eaten!  It was better than Lou Malnati's and Giordano's...sorry to say. John told us about how particular he is with sourcing his ingredients and not only use he use 100% REAL CHEESE but especially made for him.  He also has stayed loyal to a California tomato grower ;-) Real people.  Real good food.

Waited a hour and 45 minutes for a delivery and when I called they started explaining why it was taking so long, but they weren't even explaining my order, they had the wrong customer information.  When I then mentioned how long it had been for delivery and I didn't want a cold pizza delivered, the person on the phone was rude and hung up on me.  I will never give them my business again.  Terrible customer service!
As Chicago deep dish pizza goes, this is excellent. The ambiance is understated, casual, and fun. Not fine dining by any means, but a worthwhile stop for pizza and appetizers. Good wine list as well.

Visited Bacino's today as part of the Chicago food planet tours! Tried the arugula salad and spinach stuffed pizza! Both were AMAZING! We will definitely be back to try more stuffed Chicago style pizza! Yum!!!
Great stuffed spinach pizza.  Not much ambiance but delicious pizza and service.  My husband has been coming here for 30 years. He thinks it is the best pizza in the USA.

I ordered the lasagna and should've stuck to the delicious pizzas I saw being delivered to nearby tables. The lasagna was greasy, bland, and had too much of everything -- like a layer of hamburger for the meat and a layer of ricotta/romano cheese that was about 1/4 inch thick. On the plus side, the overall portion was sizable for less than $9, but I'm not super excited about having leftovers of this dish. I was disappointed in the pasta, but would return to try the pizza that they're known for.

This is a hidden gem in Lincoln Park with designer pizza. The service was awesome 'with a great smile' though we had some hungry kids. They catered to the needs of the kids and adults. Some great wheat beer on the menu.
Wouldn't look twice at the place walking by, but don't let its looks deceive you.  Pizza is amazing.   Great selection of local beers.   Had the pesto thin crust and the cheese stuffed.

I have been frequenting Bacino's for about 30 years or so.  Their pizza is what I grew up on and thus it is what I define as "Chicago-style deep-dish pizza".  It's so good.  The crust is buttery, the sauce has just the right level of sweetness and the sausage is stellar.  The creamy garlic salad dressing is wonderful too! (I can't get it here!) I live far away now.  Every time I visit Chicago we schedule at least one night to have dinner at Bacino's.  I have even flown back to California with some of their half-baked pizzas to enjoy at a later date! I have never had delivery of a deep dish pizza, but I would think it wouldn't be anywhere as near as good as an in-restaurant experience.  Just my two-cents.

Good deep dish Crust a bit moist c/w others Green salad plate warm from the dishwasher Small bit of paper in the pizza Will try others before coming back to here Not bad, but competition is strong in this town!

Simply amazing! The stuffed spinach pizza was worth the drive across town, parking 3 blocks away, risking getting towed and driving back to my hotel as quickly as possible to get a bite of this delicious pie! When I picked it up, I swear that it weighed 5 lbs, which had to be the cheesy hot mess that awaited - YUM!! :)

We found this place because of you, fellow yelpers, so we decided to check it out for ourselves.  The place is in a great neighborhood, and right next to a dairy queen (ohhh yaaa) People must mean business in here, since when we came in around 6ish on a weeknight the place was packed and the phone was ringing off the hook. We sat in the bar area and started off with a beer flight, some wine, the caprese salad and the wings. (looked like we hadn't eatin in days) Of course we needed more food so we ordered two individual pizzas. One pepperoni and cheese, and one supreme spinach without the mushrooms. Both were a perfect  size. Overall, it wasn't the BEST deep dish I've tasted in Chicago, but I would recommend giving it a try for something different. Shout out to Alex, our server, for being so friendly! The place was busy, and he handled the crowd well. Bravo Bacino's!
We were looking for an authentic deep dish and stumbled upon this on a long walk. Spinach Supreme was DIVINE!!! Highly recommend. Super nice staff too.

**** Edit:  Owner of Bacinos called us and apologized.  Offered good explanation, refunded our card and gave us a credit. However, it took over another month to get the credit and I had to contact them again.  Boo. ******************** Instead of writing a review, I'm going to cut and paste an email I sent them about their service this weekend.  They charged us for a pizza that they never delivered.  They won't reverse the charge either.  I've been eating here for 20 + years, its too bad. Attn Manager: On Sunday we ordered from Bacinos around 1ish and were given a 1:15 quote.  It was the air and water show and you guys were busy.  We called back after an hour and half and were told our order hadn't gone out but it would be to us within 15-20 minutes.  We called back after 2 full hours.  The person who answered the phone was Steve.  He apologized but told me our order still had not gone out.  He said that his driver also was not back. I've lived in the neighborhood my whole life, and worked in service for 8 years.  I know it was a busy day and traffic was bad, etc.  But we should have been called at 2 hours.  I told Steve that I wish he'd let us know, so we could have had other lunch plans and I cancelled the order.   I was disappointed we didn't get a call or a comp or a percentage off, or anything.  But you run your place as you see fit.  However, the charge... for the pizza, was not reversed.  The name is (our name and contact info here).  The charge was for $31.78. We've been eating at Bacinos for over 20 years... I'd like the charge reversed immediately.  We can ask our CC company but it doesn't seem like we should need to.  I'd also like an answer to this email in the next day... if you're unable to do it, Ill call our CC and you will lose us, along with many others as customers.

Maybe I came on a off night but I certainly wouldn't suggest this place if I was out with friends and we had other options. I ordered calamari as an appetizer and it was cold. I sent it back and 10 minutes it comes back hot and chewy.  Clearly it had been warmed up in the microwave making it chewy and inedible. I was able to get my servers attention and he confirmed it was warmed up. Initially I asked that he please replace my order with a fresh batch bit on second thought,  just canceled the order.  For my entrée I ordered the thin crust with truffle oil, it had a a unique name which escapes me at the moment.  It was really good.  My sister got stuffed spinach with mushrooms and it was ehh... Lastly my son got a thin crust with sausage and cheese,  which tasted pretty avaergae. I admit I wasn't  expecting fireworks but the thing that disappointed me the most was the service.  Again, I am hoping it was an "off" night but or server wasn't very attentive. He never followed up with me on the Gelato I asked about and we had to find him to return the calamari. So my typical 20% turned into a 15% tip.  I may try another location because I heard such great things about this location but the Lincoln Park location gets a C-. Oh and one last thing , there was 1 toliet. Not one for women and one for men but ONE bathroom.  This place is too big to only have one toilet people.

Really good deep dish and spinach-artichoke dip. Our waiter, whose name I forgot, was really nice. However, there was a tall blondish dude who also worked there who was just talking smack about one of his coworkers to all of the others the entire time and that got old really quick. I definitely don't go out to eat so that I can be inundated with the establishment's drama.

I love pizza and delicious apetezirs and this is where I come when I want bruschetta, fried cheese ravioli, and stuffed pizza,super delicious. There tomatoes taste so good. I have yet to taste there dessert. !! :)

Small old place but the wine list is good with reasonably priced bottles.  Food was great! Got the calamari and prosciutto pizza.  Actually came here cause everything else on Lincoln was close during lunch.  Happy I stopped by!  Friendly staff as well! Wish the windows were open but understand cause the weather kinda sucked.
Yum. Great pizza, god beers on tap...give it a try

Can we say AWESOME!!! Corporate training brought me to the Windy City. Hunger with a couple of eager young guys to eat and drink with brought me to Bacino's of Lincoln Park. We had a great waitress named Lauren. Lauren just moved to Chicago from Ireland. She had a great accent.I had ordered a Chicago style deep dish - Bacino's Specialty with Spanish and Cheese. It was beautiful made, and I loved it. I only got to eat 2 pieces from the small because it was so filling, but it was well worth the price.  I am not a big drinker but this night was kismet and I found Hard Cider to be my friend. I asked for a tiny sample- a sip, and Lauren brought me this flute of ACE PERRY hard cider. It was so refreshing and it went really well with my pizza pie. I now had to buy a pint of the hard cider, because I was hooked. It is on tap. Oh how I wish that there was a Bacino's in San Diego! I also ordered the flourless chocolate cake, very good.

WHY I WENT THERE: I had actually been to this same location during a visit in 2013, primarily because I (a) wanted deep dish, (b) firmly believe that any city cuisine duopoly--e.g. Gino's East and Lou Malnati's--makes the "#3 spot" the preferred option, and (c) found that this place has "heart healthy" status as bestowed by the chicago heart association.  As far as I can tell, that means that the cheese is spiced with spinach. AMBIANCE: Casual, neighborhood pizza joint. FOOD: Split the spinach pizza, which was fantastic.  My group described the crust as "graham cracker", and the filing was appropriately hot and savory.  For appretizers, we sampled fried ravioli and chicken wings, both of which were tasty but not as memorable as the main event.  If you want to eat light, this is NOT your place. DRINKS: Meager draft selection, but the can/bottle selection is a good representation of the Midwest beer scene. SERVICE: Appropriate for a place this casual. SPONTANEITY FACTOR: You can go there at the drop of a hat. SUMMARY: In the battle of "best deep dish in Chicago", this place is not at the top of the list, but that's its strength--they can focus on the food, not the tourism.
why are there so many babies here yo babies, can you even eat pizza yet? Oh yeah and the pizza is kind of the best so totally forgiveable... For now

Bacino's still has it - they are my top ranked, go-to Chicago-style stuffed pizza place!  With a set of friends, I recently conducted a Chicago pizza taste test, and they agreed that Bacino's spinach and mushroom is the best.

Great stuffed pizza with 3 cheeses, spinach and mushrooms.  We always get a good old house or Caesar salad. A good selection of beers.  We have been going there for almost 25 years. It was my Dad's favorite pizza before he moved to Florida.

Can I just first say, I hate square-cut pizza! It reminds me of being at a kid's birthday party. When I order a sheet pizza, I understand that the slices will be square. It's a rectangle. That's basic geometric understanding. So when I order a circular pie, how come that same understanding doesn't apply?? Long story short, you have to specify pie-cut if you order a pizza pie.  On to the actual pizza....ordered an Italian special thin crust for delivery. Pizza came in a reasonable time, however I'm guessing we were either the last stop on multiple stops or they didn't immediately put our pizza out for delivery as soon as it was done. I know this because of the cheese. They layer it on thick so you know fresh out of the oven it's really gooey, but by the time it got to us it had hardened. Plus, the box that it came in was lukewarm.  I probably won't order delivery again. Maybe I'll eat in there, but doubtful anytime soon.
Okay so i stopped in out of pure hunger, ordered a baked pasta and honestly cannot move now. The food here is great. The quality is fantastic and the prices are low. Good beer selection as well!
Best Chicago style pizza period. I came on a walking tour of food shops and eateries on the north side nearly 5 years ago and loved it. I came back this weekend and lived up to the 5 years of hype.
it had pretty good deep dish, i got sausage and spinach, the spinach was better, tho the sausage wasnt bad

One of my favorite pizza places.  The stuffed sausage and mushroom pizza is delicious and the crust holds up very well to the abundant toppings and sauce. It also warms up very well in the oven the next day. 325 for 20-25 minutes and it tastes as good as fresh. They also have a very nice assortment of beers on tap and in bottles. Service has always been good and friendly whenever we've been there.

I ordered an individual deep dish supreme spinach pizza with mushroom, and it was awesome. The pizza was excellent, the box is cute, the service is great and it's pretty cheap. I also ordered a tiramisu, and it was very good too, and pretty big for the price. I recommend this place!

I'd like to preface by saying I have never felt the urge to give an establishment a one star review and I have had other good experiences at this particular restaurant. However, the "delivery service" I received tonight was appalling. I ordered a pizza around 830 and was told that it would take an hour to an hour and 15 minutes. An hour and a half later, there was no food in sight. I called to make sure they had the right address. They explained that they were short a delivery driver and that it would take another 15 minutes. Two hours after my initial order, and still no food, I called again and was placed on hold. When I was finally spoken to on the phone, a female employee seemed annoyed that I had called again. She said she could give me a $10 credit But that she wasn't "trying to get attitude from me." I explained that my real concern was that the pizza might be cold after being driven around for an extended period of time. At that point she decided to unilaterally cancel my order. I clarified, and said no I don't want my order canceled, I have been waiting for two hours for food. I just want to make sure it's not cold when it gets here. She replied that it doesn't matter she already canceled it. She then hung up the phone on me. When I called back, she told me that if I called again tonight, she would make sure the restaurant never delivered to me again. She hung up a second time. After being completely dumbfounded by that treatment, again a restaurant that I order from regularly and have been a loyal customer to... I decided to call Cheesy's who had a pick up order ready for me in 10 minutes. A few minutes after securing my Cheesy's order, the delivery driver called me and said hey I just checked and your pizza is still warm if you still want it. I explained that the order had already been canceled by the employee on the phone, who he described as his assistant manager.  I like their pizza, but am seriously concerned about the ability of the operation to function in times of unique circumstances (not that being down one delivery driver is that unique). It seems like if they didn't have enough delivery drivers for the evening, they should've just told me they couldn't take my order, or offered for me to pick the pizza up. Extremely disappointed and embarrassed for the employee who spoke to me so rudely. She should probably not be in a position dealing with customers, let alone managing anyone.

Perfectly balanced stuffed pizza with a great ratio of cheese to sauce to dough. The only downside to Bacinos is having to decide between the stuffed supreme and stuffed spinach/mushroom. And if you're in the mood for some wine, the Catena Malbec is a perfect pairing!
we tried the deep dish pizza with pepporoni and sausage, it was good, but, I thought there was a bit too much cheese on it! & I really enjoy cheese. so, I would try a different place next time...

Bacino's is probably some of my favorite deep dish pizza in Chicago.  The portabella panini is also delish and though I usually get the side salad, the fries are also really good.   I usually go for delivery or carry out, but ate in for the first time this last weekend.  Service was fine and restaurant was relatively quiet which was nice. I was pleasantly surprised by their drink prices and opted for a flight of 4 beers for only $5.  Our table of 4 left stuffed for under $80.  Tip: You can actually some things (two free toppings or a free side of wings with large thing crust 2 topping pizza) with 10 Belly points here whereas most other Belly accepting places seem to be 25-30 point minimum.

I'm rating based on the 2 pizza slices ($4 each) I got at Lolla. I got the stuffed sausage and my fiance got the stuffed spinach. We thought they were pretty good. The crushed hot pepper they offered at the counter was really spicy!

Seriously good deep dish.  I love deep dish pizza and while visiting Chicago I tried this and Pizzeria Uno.  I have to say this was better than Uno.  Chock full of gooey cheese and sauce that was very aromatic with touch of sweetness.  And price-wise was nearly impossible to beat.  Get the garlic cheese breadsticks as an appetizer and you wont be disappointed.  Ambience leaves a bit to be desired, but certainly has a "hole in the wall" appeal surrounded by a college-style bar scene.

I didn't order pizza with pieces of shredded plastic, but they brought some out anyways. The waiter was apologetic but because the manager was busy "on the phone," 20 minutes after they were made aware, it took that long for him to come back and tell us she took a whole $5 beer off our tab. Wow. Mabye she was too busy on the phone ordering more shredded plastic to figure out how to actually fix kitchen mistakes and instead had her waiter explain a pathetic $5 comp. Nice dodge of any managerial responsibility!

Tried out a piece of thin crust cheese pizza at the taste of Chicago and it was great. It actually reminded me of a place around Cincinnati that serves similar pizza called La Rosas if anyone has heard of it. It definitely reminded me of that pizza which is a great thing. The crust was crunchy and just enough sauce and cheese (I don't like a lot of sauce, makes the crust soggy). I can't wait to dine in at the restaurant and have more thin crust pizza!

Best deep dish pizza in chicago by far. The crust is not to thick and the ingredients and cheese is amazing. I have never had any sort of problems with delivery time and never had any istakes on my orders. Plus the staff over the phone is polite. Great price too!

I ordered a medium sized cheese deep dish pizza for carry out. It was pretty good. I am new to Chicago and didn't really like the deep dish I tried in the past but I decided to give it another try, I was certainly impressed this time around. I can't wait to try the spinach deep dish and maybe the thin crust too. I was full from just 1.5 slices! I'll have left overs for days lol!

Bacino's has some of the best pizza in the city. I have lived in chicago my whole life and their pizza is one of the best. I love deep dish and theirs is amazing, I am however not much of a thin crust fan, and Bacinos is the only thin crust I will eat. The sauce is amazing and the toppings always fresh. I usually get pizza from them about twice a month. I suggest  to try their pizza with everything on it.

Wow. Was excited to try this place being the our house is very close and we have never tried it. Pulled up and walked around the corner to see what the wife and kids wanted me to order and the owner runs out questioning me on his loading zone that he pays for.  They should win an award for being the fastest in Chi Town to deliver poor hospitality. What a great example this man must be for his team.

Decided to order pizza from Bacino's tonight since I had a coupon for $3.00 off. I had never ordered from there before and decided to give it a try solely due to the coupon. (I mentioned the coupon when I placed the order.)  The pizzas arrived when they said it would, but after I signed the receipt, gave the driver the coupon, and he left, I noticed the $3.00 were not taken off of my bill. After eating the very mediocre pizzas (and when I say mediocre, I'm being generous), I called Bacino's to inform them that the discount had not been applied. The man who answered the phone put me on hold then came back and said there was nothing he could do since the bill was closed out. I don't believe that for a second. He could always have issued a credit to my credit card. He said to mention the coupon the next time I order. There won't be a next time. Apparently my return business is not worth $3 to them. In short, I found the pizzas to be not great and I found their customer service to be unacceptable.

We  had the stuffed pizza with sausage and mushroom.  I thought the crust was very good - nice and crispy.  We ate in so I'm not sure the crispiness would have been the same if we did carryout or delivery. The cheese was REALLY superior to other deep dish pizza places.  Nice and soft and velvety but not salty. Could have had more sausage on the pizza - thought that was a little sparse. The house salad was good also.  It was very fresh with the most delectable little house made croutons/crostini.  If they bagged these, I would eat them like chips! Bacino's now falls 3rd in my list of fav Chicago deep dish/stuffed effectively shoving out Lou Malnati's.  #1 is still My Pie for superior crust, excellent sausage and epic sauce.  #2 is Gulliver's.

Went because we had a groupon. Which now seems like a great deal.  Ordered two small deep dish- one with sausage, mushroom and onions the other with pepperoni. Loved. it. would go back in a minute. Enjoying cold pizza for breakfast leftovers. Delicious.
Best place to eat Pizza...  especially a classic Chicagoan deep dish! Do NOT miss it!

Overpriced pizza. Their deep dish is good, but nothing to run home about. It's really the only thing worth ordering. Otherwise, their regular pizza (or thin crust) is near $20 with tax and tip for a large. You could get a medium, 2-topping from across the street for a third of the price at Dom___o's and tasting better.  Don't quite get the management and servers in here. None of them are Italian or even from Chicago and they are quite rude. They have coupons on their menus but never mention those even when you are local. Oh, and we were served dirty classes. Check out the picture. All in all, go somewhere else.

Just returned home from our 1st, and last, experience at Bacino's, Lincoln Park. Food: We ordered the thin crust cheese pizza and the antipasto plate. The antipasto plate was overly salty and drenched (and drenched again) in olive oil. The pizza, let's just say it was a salt-bomb, with a touch of even more salt. Our server, Dina, was less than cordial. Her subtle snips and visible attitude to our questions of menu items were not appreciated. Overall - not a good experience. Go to any other pizza place instead. For a Lincoln Park destination, you should expect a much better experience....

I went to this place a while back and thought it was so cool that they're deep dish pizza can be ordered in a heart shape. Its my anniversary and I thought it'd be so awesome to go to this place and have a romantic evening and of course, an awesome heart shaped pizza.....NOT!!  What did I miss with this place? Was there a new management change or has their service and food literally turn to shit?? We get there and ask for our heart shaped pizza and our waitress claims she has never in her life heard of heart shaped pizza being served at this restaurant and insists theres no such thing. My husband pulls out his phone and shows her how their is a picture of heart shaped pizza on their website which in turn made this girl go ask somebody who should know....our waitress asks the host who sat us at our table. They were literally 2 feet away from us and we heard the entire convo, which was something along the lines of "Its way too busy to do that just tell em we dont do it anymore."
